6.15.25  12:21 pm   hello, i don't get imaginary numbers at all, root -1 is impossible so what's the point of saying that it exists and it's there when it's all undefined and mathematically impossible, what's the point of saying i powered by 2 when they (say) it's equal -1, even though root -1 powered by 2 is ALSO mathematically impossible, why imagine a number when it's not there? what is going on!?!?! what is all this bullshit!?!?!!!?!?!?!?!?!?

can you explain it to me in a way that you believe is comprehensible?

6.15.25  10:02 am   Since you've said before that songs should be a "myriad of simultaneous indescribable meanings", do you think that there is an infinite amount of interpretations to your songs, and thus, there isn't such a thing as an incorrect interpretation? If someone were to say, for example, that they interpreted Where I've Been as being about your opinions on the 1884-1885 Berlin Conference, I imagine that's probably not what you were thinking of when you wrote that song, but could that really be wrong?

6.15.25  1:07 am   I bet when you hear a new song you hear very different things in it than I would. Do you notice chords, chord progressions, form, instrumentation, percussion, etc?

      What do you listen for in a new song?

     I pretty much just hear the general vibe and the melody, and whether it's pop, classical, country, etc. unless something else really stands out. I think it's interesting that we could be listening to the same music, but hear very different things. It would be fun to listen to you describe what you hear in real time, so maybe I could learn to hear those things, too.

6.15.25  12:29 am   hey bill, i've come up with an interpretation for a lyric, and i'm not gonna if it's right 'right interpretation' but rather if you think it's reasonably sound. in got some money, there's a part that's like some call it 4.95, some call if 3.99, some call it a billion and is that eluding to how in super economically stable countries, they try to make their dollar the strongest even maybe by a super small amount, and in smaller maybe 3rd world countries it can have a super bad economy and their currency isn't as much. then the billion took a lot longer to sing than the other two, but they're all separate statements, equal to each other, but the billion lasts longer for the same value, which canbe like how there are a lot more poorer countries out in the world that could use help, but they're mentioned a lot less than 'rich' countries. That would affect like almost only people in the rich, because they're the only ones that can watch it, like you and me, who think and care about big 'important' countries that are rich and prosperous. perhaps i'm just talking absolute nonsense
